text:
Soar is an online Earth maps and imagery platform that allows users to search, view, and download imagery sourced from a variety of different satellite, aerial, and drone sensors.
History.
Soar was founded in 2017 after the defence and security applications behind the platform were released for civilian use. Soar was publicly launched in August 2019.
Satellite Imagery.
Soar allows users to select an area of interest (AOI) where they can view and download near real-time ESA Sentinel-2 and NASA Landsat-8 satellite imagery. Smartphone users accessing Soar online are additionally able to view imagery from NASA MODIS and JMA Himawari-8.
In October 2019 Soar announced a partnership with China’s state-owned satellite imaging company, China Siwei Surveying and Mapping Technology Co. Ltd – thereby enabling their enterprise customers to order imagery from SuperView-1 at 50cm per pixel resolution with fast turn-around times.
Drone Imagery.
Drone pilots have the functionality to upload and monetize their mapping content, providing both the pilot with a fixed commission whilst at the same time seeding Soar's 'super-map' with additional data.
Soar stores drone imagery metadata—including location, altitude, time, and equipment used—on a public blockchain.
